means: 放出空气的，通货紧缩的，物价低廉（尤指成本不降低时的反常情形）的

sentence.Network_en: With the dawning realization of what he had done , he was back on the deflationary tack.
sentence.Network_cn: 当他依稀察觉到自己的所作所为时, 又重新采取了通货紧缩的政策.

sentence.Network_en: Under these deflationary shrinkage scenarios, Europe is heading total collapse.
sentence.Network_cn: 这种通货紧缩的情况意味著欧洲正走向全面性的经济崩溃.

sentence.Network_en: Broadly, prices in Europe are tipping a deflationary dead zone.
sentence.Network_cn: 此外, 欧洲物价正接近通货紧缩的区域.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 这也正是“通货紧缩”(deflationary)作为形容词的常见含义。然而，我们不大使用“通货膨胀”(inflationary)描述与之相反的状态，而更有可 …
deflation 放气deflationary 通货紧缩的deflationist 主张通货紧缩者

list.abs: however are criticisms that such spending still falls short and issteered toward export firms rather than domestic demand , which will only exacerbate global deflationary pressures .然而，批评者认为，这些投资仍只是短期行为，而且多倾向于投入出口而不是内需部门，这将加深全球紧缩的压力。
Nor is China ' s deflationary effect on global tradable - goods prices about to end ., 中国对全球外贸商品价格的紧缩效应尚未完结.
deflation 通货紧缩deflationary force 通货紧缩力量deflator 平减物价指数

entry.def: A deflationary economic policy or measure is one that is intended to or likely to cause deflation.

example.ex: ...the government's refusal to implement deflationary measures.
example.tran: 政府拒绝实施通货紧缩举措

means.word_mean: 1. associated with or tending to cause decreases in consumer prices or increases in the purchasing power of money;
